name: FS
description: Provides enhanced functions for interacting with the file system. Accessible from scripts via the global FS variable.
overview: All paths are relative to the script's folder unless specified otherwise.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Returns an array of file and directory names within the specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to a directory, relative to the script's folder.

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Checks if a file or directory exists at the specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to a file or directory, relative to the script's folder.

methods.name: isDir
methods.description: Checks if the path points to a directory.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to check, relative to the script's folder.

methods.name: isFile
methods.description: Checks if the path points to a file.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to check, relative to the script's folder.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Gets the final component of the path (the file or directory name).

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to a file or directory.

methods.name: toRelativePath
methods.description: Converts an absolute path to a path relative to the current script's folder.

parameters.name: absolutePath
parameters.description: The absolute path to a file.

methods.name: createFile
methods.description: Creates a file in the specified directory.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The directory path where the file will be created, relative to the script's folder.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file to create.

examples:
// Create a file, assuming the 'data' directory already exists
FS.createFile("data", "log.txt");

methods.name: createFile
methods.description: Creates a file with an option to create parent directories.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The directory path where the file will be created, relative to the script's folder.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file to create.

parameters.name: createDirs
parameters.description: If true, creates any non-existent parent directories in the path.

examples:
// Create a file and any necessary parent directories
FS.createFile("logs/today", "session.log", true);

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the directory to create, relative to the script's folder.

methods.name: move
methods.description: Moves a file or directory to a new location.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The source path of the file or directory.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The destination path.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copies a file or directory to a new location.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The source path of the file or directory.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The destination path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file or directory to delete.

methods.name: combine
methods.description: Combines two paths with the correct file separator.

parameters.name: patha
parameters.description: The first part of the path.

parameters.name: pathb
parameters.description: The second part of the path.

methods.name: getDir
methods.description: Gets the parent directory of the given path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to a file or directory.

methods.name: open
methods.description: Opens a file wrapper for reading from and writing to the specified file.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the file.

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: The character set to use for reading/writing (e.g., 'UTF-8', 'UTF-32'). Defaults to 'UTF-8' if omitted.

methods.name: walkFiles
methods.description: Walks through a directory structure, executing a visitor function for each file and directory found.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The starting directory path to walk.

parameters.name: maxDepth
parameters.description: The maximum depth of directories to traverse.

parameters.name: followLinks
parameters.description: If true, symbolic links will be followed.

parameters.name: visitor
parameters.description: A function that is called for each file and directory found. It receives the path and file attributes.

methods.name: toRawFile
methods.description: Returns the raw Java File object for the specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The relative path to the file.

methods.name: toRawPath
methods.description: Returns the raw Java Path object for the specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The relative path.

methods.name: getRawAttributes
methods.description: Returns the raw Java file attributes object, or throws an IOException if the file does not exist.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The relative path to the file or directory.
